result.execSummary:
The defendant Rael Alonzo Millan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber  privileges to apply for work pursuant to Sec 303.08 WI stats.
COURT STAYED COMMENCEMENT UNTIL DECEMBER 26, 2014.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer possess any firearms or body armor.
Court will consider motion for expungement pursuant 973.015 after two years if the defendant pays; has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause, no municipal possession tickets; has employment, valid driver's license and pays his mother back the $10,000.00

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rael Alonzo Millan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request to Reinstate Release Privileges.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to reinstate release privileges.

Per Inter-Office communication received from the House of Correction:  Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge MCADAMS, Br 7, for review. OS
Bail refund notice and Affidavit re-mailed to surety 12/10/2014. dj
Bail refund notice and Affidavit mailed to surety 11/28/2014. LJ

Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in court with attorney Douglas M. Bihler and Mark Kershek.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant toserve SIX MONTHS in the House of Correction,  with credit for 17 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 12-26-14. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs, fees  and  DNA  surcharges from bail on deposit and any balance to be returned to whomever posted it. 

NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Court will consider motion for expungement pursuant 973.015 after two years if defendant pays:  has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause;no municipal possession tickets; has employment'valid driver's license and pay his mother back the $10,000.00 . 
.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. Court vacates the jury trial.  Same bail. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-24-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in court with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. Court amends charge to Possession with intent to deliver controlled substance(THC) (200 grams or less/4 plants or less pursuant to 961.41(1m)(h)1, 939.50(3)(i) Class I felony.
Defense filed witness list; motion in limine;jury instructions. lr

Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in court with attorney Douglas M. Bihler and Mark Kershek.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Justice point report received and filed. 
  Case is adjourned to branch for another final pretrial in branch 47. lr  Final pre-trial scheduled for 11-18-2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice point report received and filed.

Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in court with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.   Randy Sitzberger for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense motion to adjourn the jury trial on 9-29-14 is granted by the court.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch  47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 11-24-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense filed notice of alibi. lr

Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in court with attorney Mark E Kershek, attorney Mark Kershek and attorney Doug Bihler.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Substitution of Counsel sigend by all parties and received by the Court. Court allows attorney Martz to withdraw. Defendant withdraws his speedy trial request. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 9/5/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 9/29/2014 at 9:00 am.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

14RM013738  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/10/14 vf
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 5/2/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 5/28/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Attorney James T. Martz in court, defendant Rael Alonzo Millan not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail amended to $15,000 cash with all othe conditions to remain.

Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in court with attorney James T. Martz.  Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in custody.  Karyn Behling for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Priscilla R or David V

Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Rael Alonzo Millan in custody.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
